def_en: If someone is weak, they are not healthy or do not have good muscles, so that they cannot move quickly or carry heavy things.

def_cn: (器官或感官)功能差的，受损伤的
def_en: If someone has an organ or sense that is weak, it is not very effective or powerful, or is likely to fail.
If you describe someone as weak, you mean that they are not very confident or determined, so that they are often frightened or worried, or easily influenced by other people.

def_cn: (声音或笑容)微弱的，不热情的，无力的
def_en: If you describe someone's voice or smile as weak, you mean that it is not very loud or big, suggesting that the person lacks confidence, enthusiasm, or physical strength.

def_cn: 不牢固的;易破的;易坏的
def_en: If an object or surface is weak, it breaks easily and cannot support a lot of weight or resist a lot of strain.
A weak physical force does not have much power or intensity.

def_cn: 无权力的;无权威的;无影响力的
def_en: If individuals or groups are weak, they do not have any power or influence.

def_cn: (政府或领导人) 软弱无力的
def_en: A weak government or leader does not have much control, and is not prepared or able to act firmly or severely.

def_cn: (货币、经济、产业、政府等)疲软的，有崩溃危险的
def_en: If you describe something such a country's currency, economy, industry, or government as weak, you mean that it is not successful, and may be likely to fail or collapse.

def_cn: (论据等)不充分的，没有说服力的;(逻辑)不周密的
def_en: If something such as an argument or case is weak, it is not convincing or there is little evidence to support it.
A weak drink, chemical, or drug contains very little of a particular substance, for example because a lot of water has been added to it.
Your weak points are the qualities or talents you do not possess, or the things you are not very good at.

def_cn: （下巴）瘦小的;（尤暗指）性格懦弱的
def_en: You can say that someone has a weak chin to indicate that their chin is not large, especially when you want to suggest that they do not have a strong character.
